column1: It is caused by injury to or pressure on the sciatic nerve.
Sciatica is a symptom of another medical problem.
This nerve starts in the lower back and runs down the back of each leg.
Common causes of sciatica include: - Slipped disk - Spinal stenosis - Piriformis syndrome (a pain disorder involving the narrow muscle in the buttocks) - Pelvic injury or fracture - Tumors
Some people have sharp pain in one part of the leg or hip and numbness in other parts.
It may get worse: - After standing or sitting - At night - When sneezing, coughing, or laughing - When bending backward or walking more than a few yards, especially if caused by spinal stenosis
The health care provider will perform a physical exam.
